snippet: A two-bedroom co-op at the Beresford enters the market, but selling this Classic Six can be tricky, especially with the 200 stuffed animals displayed throughout.
abstract: Lifelong animal lover Gregory Speck is putting his Classic 6 apartment at the Beresford, Emery Roth-designed co-op at 211 Central Park West, on the market for $3.395 million and his taxidermy collection is negotiable.
lead_paragraph: A two-bedroom co-op at the Beresford enters the market, but selling this Classic Six can be tricky, especially with the 200 stuffed animals displayed throughout.

headline.seo: For Sale: Classic 6 at the Beresford Packed with Taxidermy
